item.title: Jaws: Retro Edition announced for PS5, Switch
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch

The 1987-released NES classic returns.

Limited Run Games, in partnership with Universal Products & Experiences, has announced Jaws: Retro Edition for PlayStation 5 and Switch. Pre-orders physical editions will begin on December 19, 2025 and end on January 18, 2026 via Limited Run Games.

Jaws: Retr Edition is a re-release of the 1987-launched Nintendo Entertainment System title Jaws, which was developed by Westone and produced by ATLUS.

Here is an overview of the game, via Limited Run Games:

About

This can‚Äôt be! There has never been a Great White in these warm tropical waters before, NEVER! This is more than a coincidence‚Ä¶this shark appears to be possessed‚Ä¶as if it‚Äôs hunting you down‚Ä¶ like it‚Äôs personal. You‚Äôd better prepare yourself and strike back before it‚Äôs too late.

Will you use the mini-sub, sea plane, sailboat, or just scuba gear? Perhaps it won‚Äôt even matter. Remember, this is some kind of unbelievably powerful eating machine you‚Äôre dealing with.

Quick, grab your weapons, pack your explosives, and check your maps. It‚Äôs out there‚Ä¶you know it‚Ä¶and it‚Äôs coming for you. This is serious! This is the ultimate Jaws challenge, because this time it‚Äôs not over until only one of you is left alive.

Key Features

  • Save Anywhere
  • Rewind
  • Achievements / Trophies
  • Music Player
  • Gallery

The physical editions are as follows:

Retro Edition ‚Äì $34.99

  • Physical copy of the game
  • 8-page Booklet

Jaws: The Bigger Boat Edition ‚Äì $99.99

  • Physical copy of the game
  • Everything included in the Retro Edition of the game
  • Nintendo Entertainment System-inspired box
  • Game soundtrack on a physically pressed CD
  • Pin badge Jaws keychain
  • Pixelated shark lamp

A release date was not announced.

item.title: People of Note ‚ÄòUnder the Lights‚Äô trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Featuring one of the full musical numbers from the game.

Publisher Annapurna Interactive and developer Iridium Studios have released a new trailer for turn-based RPG musical People of Note dubbed ‚ÄúUnder the Lights.‚Äù

The trailer showcases one of the full musical numbers from the game, ‚ÄúUnder the Lights‚Äù sung by the character Cadence. Cadence is played by actor Heather Gonzales, with music vocals by LEXXE.

Here is an overview of the game, via Annapurna Interactive:

About

In this bold turn-based RPG, where musical numbers meet thrilling combat, join pop singer Cadence on her quest for stardom.

Take the Stage

After being shut out of the Noteworthy Song Contest, Cadence realizes that her solo act might not be enough for the judges. As she travels across Note to the Rock City of Durandis, the EDM City of Lumina, and more, Cadence fills out her band with eclectic and powerful musicians from lands afar. But something‚Äôs brewing in the distance‚Ä¶the Harmonic Convergence is playing havoc with the world‚Äôs musical energies, and dark forces are working behind the scenes to disrupt Note‚Äôs natural harmonies. It wasn‚Äôt in the set list, but Cadence and the others need to step up and make sure music itself still has a future on stage.

In People of Note, experience turn-based combat like never before: each battle is an interactive musical performance with evolving combat conditions, real-time rhythm-based attacks, and genre-bending mashup attacks!

Key Features

  • Enjoy full-length cinematic musical sequences spanning a wide variety of musical genres, performed by our main cast of characters.
  • Experience turn-based action combat as a dynamic, interactive musical performance.
  • Tempo-Based Rhythm Combat: Time your attacks to the beat of the music for amplified damage against opponents.
  • Dynamic Combat Conditions: As the music in battle changes in real-time, strategize your attacks to synchronize with the current genre.
  • Musical Mashups: Combine the unique musical genres of your team members to unleash electrifying musical mashup attacks.
  • Explore Note, a massive world where each genre of music is represented by a completely unique environment and culture.
  • Dive into vibrant dungeons full of offbeat enemies and clever environmental puzzles.
  • Play it your way: Don‚Äôt like environmental puzzles? Turn ‚Äòem off. Not into turn-based combat? Don‚Äôt worry, we got you. The entire experience of People of Note is completely customizable.

People of Note is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store in 2026.

item.title: iam8bit, Video Game History Foundation, and Mega Cat Studios team up to bring back lost NES game Xcavator
item.content:encoded:
iam8bit has partnered with the Video Game History Foundation, Mega Cat Studios, and Retrotainment Games to bring programmer Chris Oberth‚Äôs long-long Nintendo Entertainment System game Xcavator back from the dead as Xcavatar 2025, also for Nintendo Entertainment System. It will launch as a premium physical release with a cartridge of the game and new manual. Pre-order are available now for $100 via iam8bit, with shipping to begin in Q2 2026.

‚ÄúThe original Xcavator prototype is a rare glimpse at the struggles of an indie developer trying to break into the console industry during the 8-bit golden age,‚Äù said Video Game History Foundation founder and director Frank Cifaldi in a press release. ‚ÄúThe world wasn‚Äôt ready for it in 1991, but thanks to Oberth saving his work‚Äîand to his family for getting it into archivist hands‚Äî2026 will be the year that his work will finally see the light of day. This is an important piece of game history and we‚Äôre proud to be able to raise awareness for it with the help of everyone involved.‚Äù

Here is an overview of the new release, via iam8bit:

This one-of-a-kind premium physical release comes with an Nintendo Entertainment System cartridge of the game and a brand-new manual, featuring further insights into the game and Oberth authored by the team at the Video Game History Foundation. In addition, 100 percent of the profits will go to supporting the Video Game History Foundation‚Äôs mission to preserve and celebrate the history of video games.

Fans of video games and their preservation can pre-order the product for $100 starting today at iam8bit.com. Pre-orders close on Monday, January 10, and the physical game is expected to ship in Q2 2026. Supporters of the Video Game History Foundation can also donate to the team‚Äôs Winter Fundraiser event here.

Originally developed at Incredible Technologies Inc., the company behind coin-op classics like Golden Tee Golf, Big Buck Hunter. and more, Xcavator was shopped around to multiple publishers across the country in 1991, but never found a home, and was quietly archived and never looked at again. After the original source code was donated by Oberth‚Äôs family to the Video Game History Foundation, the game was rebuilt in partnership with Mega Cat Studios. and Incredible Technologies agreed to donate the rights to the Video Game History Foundation to preserve the game intellectual property and aid the charity‚Äôs fundraising for its work within the videogames industry. Through a collective effort rooted in passion and altruism, Xcavator is now finished, staying true to Oberth‚Äôs original vision, using the same tools that would‚Äôve been used to fully develop the title in 1991.

iam8bit worked with Retrotainment to produce a classic gray Nintendo Entertainment System cartridge. The cartridge will be packed in with a 14-page manual, authored by the Video Game History Foundation. Retro gaming fans who grew up in the Nintendo Entertainment System era will find a lovingly crafted nod to manuals of the past with an additional special segment of the book dedicated to the history of Xcavator, Oberth, the studio and more, making for a release that players and retro enthusiasts can display proudly for years to come.

item.title: Slapstick physics-based co-op extraction puzzle platformer Frog Sqwad announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
Panic Stations has announced Frog Sqwad, a slapstick physics-based cooperative extraction puzzle platformer for up to eight players. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026. Playtest sign-ups are available now via the Steam page.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Storm The Sewers for the glory of the Swamp King! Swing, jump, catapult your friends, and eat eat EAT until you grow into a humongous Megafrog. A cooperative extraction puzzle platformer for up to eight players. Squad up with your frog friends for a friendslop party in this slapstick physics adventure!

Team Up With Friends

Join up to seven froggy friends in a physics-based slapstick bonanza. Use your sticky tongue to swing from pipes, solve physics puzzles, drag giant food through winding tunnels and catapult your friends, all for the glory of the ravenous Swamp King!

Find Food

Plunge into ever-changing Sewers full of hazards, weird creatures, creative challenges‚Äîand delicious snacks. Chomp down and grow bigger than your teammates. Eat enough and you‚Äôll swell into a round, rolling Megafrog!

‚Ä¶And Don‚Äôt Get Eaten

The Swamp King‚Äôs hunger grows with each passing day. Spend your well-earned Gold from successful runs on new physics toys and gadgets to give you an edge on future missions. Just make sure to meet your quotas, or you might end up as the Swamp King‚Äôs next meal!

Key Features

  • Lick Everything ‚Äì Use your tongue to lick your friends, swing from pipes, grab physics objects and pull them around, and even catapult things!
  • Extraction Loop ‚Äì Hop into The Sewers with your frog friends, gather food, and return to The Swamp to feed the Swamp King.
  • Daily Food Quota ‚Äì Make sure to hit the daily food quota to pass the day and satisfy the Swamp King.
  • Experiment With Physics ‚Äì Use anything you find in The Sewers to help you solve physics-based puzzles and platforming challenges.
  • Enemies ‚Äì The Sewers are a strange place, filled with all kinds of unusual creatures ‚Äì be on the look out!
  • Megafrog ‚Äì As you eat food, your frog will grow in size. Eat enough food to transform into a MASSIVE Megafrog with a BIG BOOMING VOICE. Roll around The Sewers in style.
  • Frogspawn ‚Äì If you take damage, you‚Äôll vomit up any food you‚Äôve eaten ‚Äì take damage on an empty stomach, and you‚Äôll transform into a pathetic frogspawn. You‚Äôll need a friend to help feed you.
  • Voice Chat ‚Äì Have a laugh with your friends over proximity chat while you play ‚Äì your frog‚Äôs mouth will animate as you talk.

We Think You‚Äôll Love Frog Sqwad If You Enjoy‚Ä¶

RV There Yet?, YAPYAP, PEAK, R.E.P.O., Content Warning, Lethal Company, Fall Guys, and more!
